key_points: Tiger Woods suffered serious leg injuries in a rollover car crash in Los Angeles County and was rushed to emergency surgery.
The crash occurred early in the morning, and Woods was conscious but trapped in his vehicle when first responders arrived.
Los Angeles County Sheriff's Deputy Carlos Gonzalez and Fire Chief Daryl Osby were among the first responders and provided details at a press conference.
Woods' injuries include a shattered ankle and two leg fractures, one of which was compound, according to the Los Angeles Times.
Sheriff Alex Villanueva noted speed appeared to be a factor in the crash, which involved Woods' vehicle hitting a center divider and several rollovers.
There was no evidence of impairment or intoxication from Woods at the time of the crash.
Woods attended the Rolling Hills Country Club with Dwyane Wade the day before the crash, and there were reports of him being agitated prior to the incident.
Woods had undergone his fifth back surgery in December and was unsure of his ability to play at the 2021 Masters Tournament.
Woods won The Masters in 2019, marking his 15th major championship win.
Members of the sports world, including Lindsey Vonn, Jack Nicklaus, and Justin Thomas, expressed concern and support for Woods.
spokespersons: Carlos Gonzalez (Los Angeles County Sheriff's Deputy)
Daryl Osby (Los Angeles County Fire Chief)
